If the Dipper’s handle is skillfully turned, driving them to circulate above and below like the flowing of the Celestial River, then Wood’s nature yearns for Metal, Metal’s essence clings to Wood, and punishment and virtue unite without barrier.

Some claim that crossing the gaze of the two eyes at the center achieves the union of Metal and Wood. This is one interpretation, yet according to the *Cantong Qi* and *Wuzhen Pian*, the separation of Metal and Wood lies within, not without. Without a teacher’s guidance, how could one ever grasp this? The *Wuzhen Pian* says: *"Though your wisdom surpasses Yan and Min, without meeting a true adept, do not force guesses."* For the elixir texts often employ metaphors to clarify principles or establish symbols to convey meaning—names and terms vary, leaving scholars who read them abruptly with nothing but a sense of vast, unfathomable distance.

Consider the Five Agents: sometimes called Metal and Wood, sometimes Metal and Earth, sometimes Water and Fire, sometimes Metal and Fire, sometimes Metal and Water, sometimes Water and Earth. The mind and eye grow dizzy—truly, it is not easily known.

**The Subtlety of the Dao’s Essentials**
The essentials of the elixir path are two: union and fire progression. Though they follow a sequence, they are but a single effort. Xiao Zixu’s *Jindan Dacheng Ji* speaks of *"the marvel of work within moments"*—how subtle, how profound! The celestial mechanism runs deep.

The celestial mechanism refers to the midnight *zi* hour, the moment when yang first stirs. As the celestial mechanism approaches, if one can activate their own mechanism to align with it, then heaven and human unite in simultaneous arousal, inner and outer correspond, and the elixir coalesces. Though it is said that within a single day’s twelve hours, every juncture of union may serve, the ancient immortals invariably chose the midnight *zi* hour—when yang first stirs—because at that time, the great yang stands precisely in the north, and the qi in the human body reaches the *Weilü* Pass, thus resonating with heaven and earth. This is what is meant by "stealing from heaven and earth, seizing the workings of creation"—only at this moment is it so. By the *chou* hour, the Great Unity has already shifted, and the qi in the human body has passed the *Weilü* Pass. By the *yin* hour, the great yang has already risen above the earth, and the qi in the human body has passed the Kidney Hall—neither may be used. The *Yuzhi Shu* states: "In refining the elixir, one must kindle the fire in accord with the yang qi of the *zi* hour—only then is the fire truly ignited. If the fire is kindled at any other time, it remains incomplete." These words exhaust the matter.

"To begin swift cultivation is already too late.
*Begin* refers to the moment of refinement and firing. Gather the spirit of the entire body into the Heavenly Valley Cavity—yet do not let it stray, for this is no mere act of grasping. Some cling to the phrase *begin* and take it to align with the *Wuzhen Pian*’s line, 'Seize with both hands and make it die,' thus straining to clench their fists, or covering their ears and nose, or rubbing their waist and abdomen, or pressing the thumb into the palm, or prodding the navel with the middle finger—is this not labor in vain?

*Swift cultivation is already too late* means that time flies swiftly, and one must cultivate without delay. The path to Penglai is trodden only when three thousand deeds are complete, walking alone upon the clouds to return.

*Three thousand deeds complete* refers to nine years, or three thousand days. Within these three thousand days, one must accumulate virtue and amass good deeds, never straying from the Dao for even a moment in the twelve hours. As Liu Xugu’s *Huandan Pian* states: 'To perfect the great elixir requires three thousand days; its wondrous work must not falter in the twelve hours.'

In the alchemical method, the embryo forms in a single instant, the work proves efficacious in a hundred days, the embryo matures in a year, and the deeds are complete in nine years—each stage has its measure. There is no principle by which one may meet a master today and become an immortal tomorrow. Know that in one year, there is minor attainment; in nine years, a great transformation. First, the qi is transformed; next, the blood; then the vessels; then the flesh; then the marrow; then the sinews; then the bones; then the hair; and finally, the form. After nine years and nine transformations, the yin qi is refined away, and pure yang is achieved. Only then may one leave the world behind, stand alone, and ascend as an immortal on feathered wings.

Have you not read the *Youji Jixian Zhuan*, which records Chen Chaoyuan’s admonition to the world: 'Those who perform good deeds will surely enjoy blessings; those who accumulate hidden virtue will see their descendants flourish. To not waste the things of heaven, to not indulge in theft or lust, to not destroy the true teaching—these are good deeds. To save the dying and aid the wounded, to rush to others’ distress, to never conceal or harm—these are hidden virtues. Without good deeds or hidden virtue, the paths of evil will find no barrier!'

Chaoyuan’s words were spoken for the common folk—how much more do they apply to those who seek immortality! Generally, to cultivate the Dao of immortality, one must first cultivate the Dao of humanity. If the Dao of humanity is not cultivated, the Dao of immortality remains distant.

Have you not also seen the *Wuzhen Pian*’s lines: 'The great medicine is cultivated with ease or difficulty; know that it depends on me, yet also on heaven. Without accumulating deeds and cultivating hidden virtue, demons will arise at every turn to obstruct the path.'

How can scholars use the saying 'my fate is in my own hands' as an excuse and not treat the accumulation of deeds as urgent?

Alas! With three thousand deeds, one becomes an immortal of the Great Veil; with eight hundred deeds, one becomes a guest of the Great Veil. Let our fellowship strive for this!"

The Great Medicine is none other than essence, qi, and spirit;
Its pivotal mechanism lies wholly in Master Qinyuan Chun’s profound grasp of Pure Yang’s intent,
Who exhaustively expounded the subtle workings for all to know.

On the fifteenth day of the fourth month in the yiwei year of the Yuanzhen era,
Wang Zhuzhong of Sanshan respectfully inscribed this with incense reverence.

**Preface to the Reprinted *Lingbao Bifa***

In my youth, I was already enamored of the true Dao, secretly immersing myself in alchemical texts. Recently, a friend from Yuzhang arrived, bringing me a copy of *Lingbao Bifa*. Some say it originated from a family collection in Sichuan. I burned incense and began to read. Though I have not yet fully grasped its profound mysteries, the realms of humans and heavens have become vaguely clear to me. I now understand that Ancestor Zhongli distilled the secret subtleties of the *Lingbao Sutra* and transmitted them to Ancestor Lü to deliver the world—both practiced it diligently, distilling the vast into the essential, thereby attaining self-cultivation.

Now, sharing it with like-minded friends, I am deeply delighted and thus seek patrons to publish it for the benefit of all virtuous people. Yet some may say: "Ancestor Zhongli once stated that this scripture links the eight trigrams with the twelve hours, with its essence in *Gen*; the three fields cycle repeatedly, with their crux in the *Niwan*; the initial practice begins with swallowing qi and rinsing saliva as metaphors, but the true qi and oral instructions rely on direct transmission, not mere words." After reading it several times, I find the oral instructions for cultivation detailed and exhaustive. Though its words are veiled, its Dao shines forth.

Master Yichuan said: "The human mind is most agile, shifting in myriad forms. There has never been one who, doing nothing, could empty-mindedly guard it. Beginners, unaware of the method of restraint, must immerse themselves in the words of sages, letting principles delight the heart, so that the celestial mechanism flows smoothly—one cannot rigidly hold or forcefully guard." This aligns with the Buddhist teaching of illuminating the mind with reciting the Buddha’s name as its core. In our Most High’s thirty-six revered scriptures, the sacred titles of the Celestial Venerables are repeatedly invoked—how could this be in vain?

Mencius said: "Those with roots are like this; this is what they take." As for the meaning of the eight trigrams and three fields, it is rooted in a day having four seasons and a heart containing the five phases. Moment by moment, one can seize the *qi* of heaven and earth as medicine for the body. At the *Gen* trigram’s hour, it is even more abundant. The *Niwan* is the palace of spirit and the source of *qi* and essence—it must not be neglected. If one can preserve and practice this, they will witness the yellow sprout grow and the embryo form, the millet grain mature and the spirit ascend—thus fulfilling the great man’s work.

I wish to explore this together with all readers of *Lingbao Bifa*. This serves as the preface.

Written in the spring of the *Jimao* year, the fifth year of the Guangxu reign of the Great Qing, on an auspicious day at the Dawn Window Mountain Studio of White Bamboo Slope by Gu Tan’s Luo Yuan and the clamorous De Wen.

---

**Original Preface to *Lingbao Bifa* (II)**

The Dao cannot be transmitted through words nor recorded by names. Since ancient times, those who ascended as immortals or attained the Dao have not been few. I, aspiring to follow the ancients, have long cherished the great Dao. Unexpectedly, war arose, and the times grew perilous. Initially seeking refuge, I wandered rivers and lakes, mountains and valleys. Retreating, I recognized my nature and focused my mind, dwelling only in purity and tranquility.

Having studied alchemical texts and consulted Daoist friends, I found they spoke only of minor techniques for nourishing life, not the grand Dao of true immortality. Then, in the stone walls of Zhongnan Mountain, I obtained the *Lingbao Sutra* in thirty volumes: the upper section, *Golden Decrees*, composed by the Primordial Beginning; the middle section, *Jade Records*, written by the Primordial Sovereign; and the lower section, *True Source Teachings*, transmitted by the Most High. Together, they comprise thousands of characters.

I rose early and retired late, pondering deeply, and realized: within yin there is yang, within yang there is yin—this is the natural ascent and descent of heaven and earth; within *qi* water is born, within water *qi* is born—this is the principle of heart and kidney communion. By comparing these images, the Dao is not far from man.

Matching *Jia* and *Geng*—only then is the golden elixir verified;
Drawing from *Mao* and adding to *You*—naturally, the fire timing is flawless.
Red lead and black lead—thoroughly refined, they do not form the great medicine;
Golden liquid and jade liquid—only at the end do they become the returning elixir.
From nothing to being—once warlike intentions are set aside,
From below to above—gradually entering the realm of the subtle and serene.
Extracting lead and adding mercury—causing the two eights of yin to dissolve;
Refining bones and forging form—enabling the nine threes of yang to grow.
The source of water, clear or turbid—distinguished at the moment of *Jiji*;
The inner landscape, true or void—recognized in the state of *Zuowang*.

The profound subtleties of the mysterious mechanism are difficult to fully express. Yet the wondrous principles of *Lingbao* can be used to enter sagehood and transcend the mundane.

The comprehensive teaching of the Three Vehicles is titled *The Complete Methods of Lingbao*. The sacred words of the Great Dao must not be hoarded by one individual, and so they are transmitted to the esteemed Dongbin. Once the Dao is attained, do not conceal it; rather, bequeath it to those who come after. Preface by Zhongli Quan, the True Man of Zhengyang.

**Lesser Vehicle: Methods for Peace and Longevity (Volume One)**
**First Gate: The Union of Yin and Yang**
*(Yang Embryo and Yin Breath, True Embryonic Breath, Union of Kan and Li)*

The Jade Scripture states: The Great Dao is formless—sight and hearing cannot perceive it; the Great Dao is nameless—measurement and calculation cannot fathom it. It gives rise to form through the Dao, and through form, names are established. The greatest of these names are Heaven and Earth. Heaven embodies the Dao of Qian, accumulating qi to cover what lies below; Earth embodies the Dao of Kun, supporting substance to bear what lies above. Between the covering and bearing, the distance between above and below spans eighty-four thousand *li*, where qi and substance cannot interact. Heaven, through Qian, seeks Kun and returns to the center of Earth, its yang carrying yin upward; Earth, through Kun, seeks Qian and returns to the center of Heaven, its yin embracing yang downward. In this ascent and descent, the Dao is enacted, and thus Heaven and Earth endure.

The True Source states: Between Heaven and Earth, what is close to the above is yang. From above to below, forty-two thousand *li* constitute the "Yang Position." What is close to the below is yin. From below to above, forty-two thousand *li* constitute the "Yin Position." Once form and name exist, they cannot escape measurement. Consider one year: four seasons, eight solar terms, twenty-four qi, seventy-two pentads, three hundred sixty days, and four thousand three hundred twenty hours. Twelve hours make a day, five days a pentad, three pentads a qi, three qi a solar term, two solar terms a season, and four seasons a year. The year begins with the Winter Solstice. At this time, yang ascends from Earth. Each qi lasts fifteen days, ascending seven thousand *li*. Three qi form a solar term, forty-five days in total, with yang ascending twenty-one thousand *li*. Two solar terms make a season, ninety days in total, with yang ascending forty-two thousand *li*, precisely reaching the center between Heaven and Earth, where yang converges with the Yin Position. At this time, yang is half within yin, its qi warm, corresponding to the Spring Equinox. Beyond this, yang ascends into the Yang Position, truly gaining qi to rise. Similarly, forty-five days later is the Beginning of Summer. After another forty-five days comes the Summer Solstice. At the Summer Solstice, yang ascends, totaling eighty-four thousand *li* to reach Heaven, where yang is within yang, its qi hot. Accumulated yang generates yin, and one yin arises within two yang. Beginning with the Summer Solstice, yin descends from Heaven. Each qi lasts fifteen days, descending seven thousand *li*. Three qi form a solar term, forty-five days in total, with yin descending twenty-one thousand *li*. Two solar terms make a season, ninety days in total, with yin descending forty-two thousand *li*, reaching the center between Heaven and Earth, where yin converges with the Yang Position. At this time, yin is half within yang, its qi cool, corresponding to the Autumn Equinox. Beyond this, yin descends into the Yin Position, truly gaining qi to descend. Similarly, forty-five days later is the Beginning of Winter. After another forty-five days comes the Winter Solstice. At the Winter Solstice, yin descends, totaling eighty-four thousand *li* to reach Earth, where yin is within yin, its qi cold. Accumulated yin generates yang, and one yang arises within two yin. After the Winter Solstice, one yang ascends again as before. This circulation continues endlessly, ever returning to its beginning, never deviating from the Dao. At the Winter Solstice, yang is born, ascending to return to Heaven; at the Summer Solstice, yin is born, descending to return to Earth. At the Summer Solstice, yang ascends to Heaven and one yin arrives; at the Winter Solstice, yin descends to Earth and one yang arrives. Hence, they are called the "Summer Solstice" and "Winter Solstice." Yang ascends above, passing the Spring Equinox to enter the Yang Position, departing the Yin Position; yin descends below, passing the Autumn Equinox to enter the Yin Position, departing the Yang Position. Hence, they are called the "Spring Equinox" and "Autumn Equinox." After the Winter Solstice, as yang ascends, yin does not cease to descend; the descending yin is merely residual yin within yang, dissipating within the Yang Position. Even if it descends to its position and encounters ascending yang, its qi is exhausted. After the Summer Solstice, as yin descends, yang does not cease to ascend; the ascending yang is merely residual yang within yin, dissipating within the Yin Position. Even if it ascends to its position and encounters descending yin, its qi is exhausted. The ascent and descent of yin and yang, above and below, do not exceed eighty-four thousand *li*, and their coming and going cannot escape three hundred sixty days. Through the four qi of warmth, coolness, cold, and heat, one discerns yin and yang; through the eight solar terms of yang’s ascent and yin’s descent, one understands Heaven and Earth. Measuring this with the mechanism of Heaven, one may grasp the remnants of the Great Dao. If relying on mere oral and aural learning to weigh the Dao of Heaven and Earth, how can one fathom it through calculation?

For analogy: The Dao gives birth to the myriad things, and Heaven and Earth are the greatest among them; humans are the most spiritually endowed. Humans correspond to Heaven and Earth: the heart is likened to Heaven, the kidneys to Earth; the liver is the Yang Position, the lungs the Yin Position. The distance between heart and kidneys is eight *cun* and four *fen*, analogous to the space between Heaven’s covering and Earth’s bearing. Qi is likened to yang, and fluid to yin. The *zi* and *wu* hours correspond to the Summer and Winter Solstices; the *mao* and *you* hours correspond to the Spring and Autumn Equinoxes.

A single day mirrors a full year; the eight trigrams of a day correspond to the eight solar terms. At the *zi* hour, qi arises within the kidneys; by the *mao* hour, it reaches the liver. The liver being yang, its qi flourishes, ascending into the yang position—analogous to the Spring Equinox. By the *wu* hour, qi arrives at the heart, where accumulated qi generates fluid—comparable to the Summer Solstice, when yang ascends to Heaven and yin begins to stir. At the *wu* hour, fluid arises within the heart; by the *you* hour, it flows to the lungs. The lungs being yin, their fluid abounds, descending into the yin position—analogous to the Autumn Equinox. At the *zi* hour, fluid returns to the kidneys, where accumulated fluid engenders qi—comparable to the Winter Solstice, when yin descends to Earth and yang begins to stir. This cycle repeats endlessly, its movement ceaseless, like the revolutions of the sun and moon, neither diminishing nor waning, thus ensuring longevity.

The true secret states: The Dao of Heaven and Earth is attained in unity—only humans possess this capacity. Yet having received form from father and mother, and form giving rise to further form, one drifts ever farther from the Dao. After the fetus is complete and qi is full, the six desires and seven emotions dissipate original yang and scatter true qi. Though qi and fluid naturally generate one another, they cannot ascend and descend as in Heaven and Earth. With each exhalation, original qi departs; with each inhalation, original qi enters, drawing in the qi of Heaven and Earth—yet once taken in, it cannot be retained, and with the next exhalation, it departs again. The qi of one’s own palace is instead seized by Heaven and Earth, so that scattered qi scarcely generates fluid, and scant fluid scarcely generates qi.

When qi is at its peak, employ the *mao* trigram daily: for qi, take in more and release less, forcibly retaining it within the abdomen. Thus, what naturally ascends from below does not escape, and what enters from without lingers briefly. The two qi converge, accumulating to generate the fluids of the five viscera, replenishing the origin ever more abundantly. With daily practice over time, results will appear and persist.

The essential Dao states:
To meet the eldest son of yang’s lord,
One must take in more and release less—
Let the children contend among themselves,
Then seek the true one when the time is past.
This is the method of accumulating qi to generate fluid, and accumulating fluid to generate qi, the art of harmonizing qi and fluid in mutual generation. In practice, no more than a year is needed to seize the achievement; take three hundred days in a year as the term, and results will appear within ten days. With increased food and drink, illnesses vanish.

The head and eyes become clear and sharp, the heart and abdomen feel empty and light; strength increases while fatigue diminishes, and at times the sound of wind and thunder arises within the belly. The remaining signs are too numerous to record.

Explanation states: The "eldest son of yang’s lord" is the *gan* seeking the *kun*, like qi ascending upward. The "son" is qi, rising from the kidneys; the "daughter" is fluid, descending from the heart. Their contention is the interplay of above and below. Closing the qi generates fluid, and accumulating fluid generates qi, balancing the two. When the time is past, true water is naturally obtained.

Direct Explanation states: This is the initial step, taken during the *mao* hexagram when yang rises and qi flourishes. One inhales more of heaven and earth’s upright qi and exhales less of one’s own original qi. Thus, the two qi converge, qi accumulates to generate fluid, and abundant fluid generates qi—this is the method of matching yin and yang, the mutual generation of qi and fluid.

**Gathering and Dispersing Water and Fire (Second) [Taiyi Containing True Qi, Minor Refinement of Form, Heavenly Youth Never Aging]**

The *Jin Gao* states: The so-called Great Dao is lofty yet without superior—look up to observe it, and above it there is no above, nor can its beginning be seen. The so-called Great Dao is lowly yet without inferior—look down to examine it, and below it there is no below, nor can its foundation be seen. It has no predecessor at its inception, nor can its front be seen; it has no end at its conclusion, nor can its rear be seen. Within the Great Dao, heaven and earth are born; heaven and earth possess the forms of high and low. Within heaven and earth, there are yin and yang; yin and yang possess the numbers of beginning and end. Rising and falling, looking up and down, one may fathom its mechanism; beginning and ending, measuring and calculating, one may grasp its principle. Through this, the Great Dao may be known.

The *True Source* states: From the positions of heaven and earth above and below, one knows that heaven and earth have high and low; from the cycles of yin and yang’s beginning and end, one knows the before and after of the heavenly Dao. Heaven and earth do not depart from their numbers, and their numbers conclude in one year; yin and yang do not lose their proper timing, and their timing divides at the eight nodes. At the winter solstice, one yang is born; at the spring equinox, yang is half within yin. Beyond this, pure yang prevails and yin is exhausted. At the summer solstice, yang reaches its great extreme and one yin is born; at the autumn equinox, yin is half within yang. Beyond this, pure yin prevails and yang is exhausted. At the winter solstice, yin reaches its great extreme and one yang is born, rising and falling as before. Though the cycles of above and below, beginning and end cannot fully encompass the Great Dao, they do not depart from its essence. To understand the Great Dao, one must take heaven and earth as a model and carefully examine the proper timing of yin and yang.

Analogy states: Compare the heart and kidneys to heaven and earth, qi and fluid to yin and yang, and one day to one year. In daily practice: the *gen* hexagram corresponds to the *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring) node in a year; the *qian* hexagram corresponds to the *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter) node in a year. Within heaven and earth, that which is closer to the lower is yin; from below upward, forty-two thousand *li* is called the yin position, where yang is born at the winter solstice and ascends. At the time of *Lichun*, yang rises within the yin position at twenty-one thousand *li*—this is when yang struggles to overcome yin. Within heaven and earth, that which is closer to the upper is yang; from above downward, forty-two thousand *li* is called the yang position, where yin is born at the summer solstice and descends. At the time of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn), yin descends within the yang position at twenty-one thousand *li*—this is when yin struggles to overcome yang. At the time of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), yang ascends upward, sixty-three thousand *li* from the earth and twenty-one thousand *li* from heaven—this is when yang attains its position and yin is cut off. At the time of *Lidong*, yin descends downward, sixty-three thousand *li* from heaven and twenty-one thousand *li* from the earth—this is when yin attains its position and yang is cut off. Within a year, *Lichun* corresponds to the *gen* hexagram (the *chou-yin* hours) in a day. Kidney qi transmits downward to the bladder, weak within the fluid—this is the time when yang qi struggles to ascend. Within a year, *Lidong* corresponds to the *qian* hexagram (the *xu-hai* hours) in a day. Heart fluid descends, about to return to the origin and re-enter the kidneys—this is the time when yin flourishes and yang is cut off. People suffer from disharmony between yin and yang, with yang weak and yin abundant, hence illnesses are many.

The *True Formula* states: When yang rises at spring’s beginning, from below upward, it does not take long for yang to be half within yin (the *gen* hexagram’s *chou-yin* hours, when qi is weak). When yin descends at winter’s beginning, from above downward, it does not take long for yin to be half within yang (the *qian* hexagram’s *xu-hai* hours, when qi disperses). Such is the Way of heaven and earth. Yet for people: during the *gen* hexagram when qi is weak, they do not know the method of nurturing qi; during the *qian* hexagram when qi disperses, they do not understand the principle of gathering qi. Day and night, with the six desires and seven emotions, they dissipate original yang, causing true qi to weaken; losing true qi, true fluid does not generate. Thus, they cannot attain the longevity of heaven and earth. Therefore, the ancients practiced *zhun* in the morning and *meng* in the evening, using these two hexagrams daily to achieve long life in the world.

*Morning Zhun*: This takes the meaning of one yang below, bent and not yet extended. For oneself, one nurtures and extends it, preventing dissipation. *Evening Meng*: This takes the meaning of a child seeking me, turning toward brightness and abandoning darkness—yin seeking yang. For oneself, one obscures and then illuminates, preventing loss. Thus, at sunrise, one should use the time of the *gen* hexagram to nurture original qi. Do not let profit and fame disturb the heart, nor let likes and dislikes interfere with the mind. Don a robe and sit quietly to nurture qi; cut off thoughts and forget emotions, gently performing guiding exercises. Alternate the hands and feet, stretching and contracting three to five times, so that the qi of the four limbs arises together, internally preserving original qi to ascend and pay court to the heart palace. Or swallow saliva once or twice, rub the head and face twenty to thirty times, and exhale the stagnant, turbid qi accumulated through the night.

With prolonged practice, the complexion becomes radiant and lustrous, the skin smooth and glowing (the *gen* hexagram nurtures original qi). Furthermore, at sunset, one should use the time of the *qian* hexagram to gather original qi. Enter a chamber and sit quietly, swallowing qi and retracting the external kidneys. Swallowing qi draws the heart’s fire downward; retracting the external kidneys gathers the bladder’s qi inward (the *qian* hexagram gathers original qi). Thus, upper and lower unite, the fire of kidney qi converges with the three fires to become one, warming the lower elixir field. Without fluid, gather qi to generate fluid; with fluid, refine fluid to generate qi—this is called "gathering fire," also named "Great Unity," containing true qi. The morning practice of swallowing saliva and rubbing the face, alternating hands and feet in stretching, is called "dispersing fire," also known as "minor refinement of form."

The essential Dao states:
*Petals wither, leaves fall in late autumn—*
*The jade-like one grows weary of ascending the perilous tower.*
*To achieve harmony between ruler and people,*
*At the feast’s end, frequently gather and withdraw.*

This means drawing the heart’s qi downward and gathering the bladder’s qi inward, preventing dissipation so they unite with kidney qi to connect with the *kan* hexagram. The newly generated qi in the sea of qi must begin at the start of winter, and practice continues until results appear. The regimen need not exceed a year to yield accomplishment; a full year of three hundred days is the term, with results visible in ten days: the countenance glows, the skin becomes plump and radiant, the cinnabar field grows warm, urination decreases, the four limbs feel light and strong, the spirit is clear and refreshed, and chronic ailments and long-standing illnesses all vanish. If one cherishes time and practices tirelessly, even within the work of harmonizing yin and yang, slight results may appear. This method is then incorporated into daily practice, adding the *gen* hexagram’s work and briefly applying this technique. The three origins of the *qian* hexagram take effect, and practice continues until results manifest (the three origins are *qian*, *gen*, and *zhen*).

Explanation:
The line *"Petals wither, leaves fall in late autumn"* likens human qi to the fading light of dusk, where yang qi scatters and fails to ascend—hence the weariness of ascending the perilous tower. The "tower" refers to the twelve-storied tower. The heart is the ruler’s fire, the bladder the people’s fire. Swallowing qi and retracting the external kidneys unites the heart’s qi with the external kidneys’ qi as one—this is harmony. "Feast" refers to swallowing, "withdraw" to retracting. The morning practice is unbroken, for this method is the foundation.

Direct Explanation:
The *gen* hexagram’s yang qi is subtle, so one gently performs guiding exercises, stretching and contracting, swallowing saliva, and rubbing the face to disperse fire throughout the four limbs and nurture original qi. The *qian* hexagram’s yang qi scatters, so one swallows the heart’s qi and retracts the external kidneys to unite with kidney qi, merging the three fires into one to gather original qi. Thus, gathering and dispersing water and fire strengthens the root and solidifies the foundation.

**Third: The Union of Dragon and Tiger**
*(Absorbing and replenishing the elixir, nurturing the immortal embryo—true husband and wife meet in the harmony of water and fire, qi unites while form remains distinct)*

The *Golden Edict* states: When the Great Origin first divided, there was the Great Beginning; within the Great Beginning, there was the Great Void; within the Great Void, there was the Great Emptiness; within the Great Emptiness, there was the Great Substance. The Great Substance is the clear and turbid essence of heaven and earth. Its form is like an egg, its color dark and yellow—within the Great Emptiness, it is but a single thing. When yang ascends to heaven, it reaches the Supreme Ultimate and generates yin, which in profound obscurity embraces yang and descends; when yin descends to earth, it reaches the Supreme Ultimate and generates yang, which in boundless vastness bears yin and ascends. With each ascent and descent, yin descends and yang ascends—heaven and earth follow the Dao, and the myriad things are born and completed.

The *True Source* states: Heaven is like an overturned basin, where yang, upon arrival, struggles to ascend; earth is like a slab of stone, where yin, upon arrival, struggles to enter. At the winter solstice, yang within the earth ascends; at the summer solstice, when it reaches heaven, its yang attains the Supreme Ultimate and generates yin. The reason yin arises is that yang emerges from within yin, rising from the earth. In a state of indistinct confusion, qi contains water, though this water has no form. When the summer solstice reaches heaven, accumulated qi transforms into water—this is "yang attains the Supreme Ultimate and yin is born." At the summer solstice, yin within heaven descends; at the winter solstice, when it reaches earth, its yin attains the Supreme Ultimate and generates yang. The reason yang arises is that yin emerges from within yang, issuing from heaven. In profound obscurity, water contains qi, though this qi has no form. When the winter solstice reaches earth, accumulated water generates qi—this is "yin attains the Supreme Ultimate and yang is born."

Metaphorically: compare the body’s exterior to the Great Emptiness, the heart and kidneys to heaven and earth, qi and fluids to yin and yang, and the hours of *zi* and *wu* to winter and summer. The *zi* hour corresponds to the *kan* hexagram, when qi ascends from the kidneys; the *wu* hour corresponds to the *li* hexagram, when fluids generate in the heart. When kidney qi reaches the heart, it unites with the heart’s qi, and the Supreme Ultimate generates fluid. The reason fluid arises is that qi comes from the kidneys, and within qi lies true water, though this water has no form. When the *li* hexagram reaches the heart, it connects with the heart’s qi, and the Supreme Ultimate thus generates fluid. When heart fluids reach the kidneys, they unite with kidney water, and the Supreme Ultimate once more generates qi. The reason qi arises is that fluids come from the heart, and within fluids lies true qi, though this qi has no form. When the *kan* hexagram reaches the kidneys, it connects with kidney water, and the Supreme Ultimate thus generates qi. This can be likened to yang ascending and yin descending, reaching the Supreme Ultimate and mutually generating. The generated yin and yang conceal water within yang and qi within yin.

The *True Oral Instructions* state: Qi generated in the kidneys contains true water; fluids generated in the heart contain true qi. True water and true qi are the true dragon and true tiger. When yang reaches heaven, it struggles to ascend, and the Supreme Ultimate generates yin; when yin reaches earth, it struggles to enter, and the Supreme Ultimate generates yang. Such is the principle of heaven and earth. Humans cannot compare to heaven and earth because the six desires and seven emotions, stirred by external things, scatter original yang and lose true qi.

When kidney qi of the *Li* trigram ascends to the heart, the spirit and consciousness settle inwardly, the breath enters slowly through the nose and exits gently, continuous as if present—then the mouth fills with saliva, which is swallowed down. Naturally, kidney qi and heart qi unite, and the Supreme Ultimate generates fluid. When heart fluid of the *Kan* trigram descends to the kidneys, joining kidney water, naturally heart fluid and kidney qi unite, and the Supreme Ultimate generates qi. As true qi clings to fluid and true water clings to qi, fluid and true water are originally conjoined, thus fluid contains true qi and qi contains true water. Mutually intermingling and descending together, this is called the "union of dragon and tiger." If the firing times are without error and the withdrawal and addition are fitting, after three hundred days the true embryo is nurtured, forming the great elixir—the foundation of refining the body, burning the form, ascending to the origin, and transcending.

The *Essential Instructions* state:
*When primal qi first returns to the original movement,*
*True yang is about to reach the Li palace—seize the true dragon and true tiger.*
*The Jade Pool’s spring waters flow abundantly—*
*Beware lest primal qi leak away, true water escape beyond the body.*
*If qi scatters, fluid is hard to generate; if fluid is scant, true qi is absent.*
*When qi and water fail to unite, how can the great elixir form?*

At such times: within the year, use the months, beginning at the winter solstice; within the day, use the hours, taking the *Li* trigram as the appointed time. If one embraces the Dao in later years, with foundational vitality unstable, and self-assesses as depleted and deficient, with insufficient qi—then ten years’ depletion requires one year of practice to replenish, called "gathering and replenishing the returning elixir." Once replenishment reaches the required measure, cease this method, now called "water and fire in mutual aid," which can extend life and increase longevity—this is termed a "human immortal," its efficacy beyond full recounting. If replenishment is complete, sweet saliva arises in the mouth, the heart’s afflictions vanish of themselves, passions and desires are stilled, the hundred bones are free of illness, and the spirit’s radiance appears unseen, the eyes at times flashing like lightning. Beginning on the winter solstice, carefully regulate the method, and after three hundred days the true embryo is delivered—this is called the "immortal embryo."

Explanation: Externally, the noon hour is the *Li* trigram; the sun is true yang. In humans, the heart is the *Li* palace, and original yang is the true dragon. The true tiger is the water within the kidneys; the true dragon is the qi within the heart’s fluid. The mouth is the Jade Pool, and saliva is spring water.

Direct Explanation: When primal qi first returns to the original movement, take the winter solstice as the beginning—this is the *zi* month. When true yang is about to reach the *Li* palace, take the *Li* trigram as the appointed time—this is the noon hour. The true dragon is the qi within the heart’s fluid; the true tiger is the water within kidney qi. When qi and water unite, this is called the "union of dragon and tiger."

**Refining the Elixir and Cultivating the Medicine (Fourth)**
*(Firing Times, Small Celestial Cycle, Gathering Spirit and Nurturing Qi, Gathering Qi and Nurturing Spirit, Refining Yang and Nurturing Spirit)*

The *Golden Edict* states: Heaven and earth are the forms of the great Dao; yin and yang are the qi of the great Dao. Cold, dampness, heat, and coolness are qi within form; clouds, mist, rain, and dew are images within qi. Earth’s qi ascends, rising as clouds and dispersing as rain; heaven’s qi descends, scattering as mist and condensing as dew. When accumulated yin is excessive, dew becomes rain, frost, or snow; when accumulated yang is excessive, mist becomes smoke, clouds, or rosy clouds. When yang lies hidden within yin, yang qi fails to ascend, striking and clashing to generate thunder; when yin lies hidden within yang, yin qi fails to descend, congealing to form hail or sleet. When yin and yang fail to unite, they oppose each other, generating lightning; when yin and yang are mismatched, their chaotic union produces rainbows. Accumulated true yang forms spirits, adorning the heavens as stars; accumulated true yin forms shapes, strengthening the earth as soil and stone. The greatest of stars are the sun and moon; the most precious of soil and stone are gold and jade. Yin and yang manifest in tangible forms: above as the sun and moon, below as gold and jade.

The *True Source* states: Yin cannot generate without yang; yang cannot complete without yin. Accumulated yang becomes spirit, adorning the heavens, and the greatest are the sun and moon—the sun and moon are true yang, completed by true yin. Accumulated yin becomes form, strengthening the earth, and the most precious are gold and jade—gold and jade are true yin, generated by true yang. *(Practice in the xū and hài hours; gather the medicine in the Li trigram; advance the fire in the Qián trigram.)*

Analogy: True yang is likened to the true qi within heart fluid; true yin is likened to the true water within kidney qi. True water cannot generate without true qi; true qi cannot complete without true water. True water and true qi, compared to the *Li* trigram, harmonize above the heart and below the lungs, like mother and child clinging to each other, husband and wife loving each other. From *Li* to *Duì*, when the *Duì* trigram’s yin is flourishing and yang is weak, this is like the moon’s last quarter, gold and jade in darkness—useless. The sun and moon are completed by yin, their measure full to generate brightness; gold and jade are generated by yang, their qi full to form treasure. Gold and jade become treasure because their qi is sufficient, and yang is added; the sun and moon generate brightness because their measure is full, and spirit is bestowed. This is like advancing the fire in the *Qián* trigram, refining yang without decline. Fire increases in measure, and yang is born anew.

The *True Instructions* state: When the dragon and tiger unite in the *Li* trigram, this is called "gathering the medicine." When the time reaches the *Qián* trigram, qi and fluid are about to return to the origin, arising above the bladder, below the spleen and stomach, before the kidneys, behind the navel, to the left of the liver, to the right of the lungs, to the right of the small intestine, and to the left of the large intestine. At that time, spleen qi is flourishing and lung qi is abundant, while heart qi is cut off and liver qi is weak. True qi originally comes conjoined with yang qi; when yang qi is weak, true qi has nothing to cling to, and effort is spent in vain on gathering and uniting. At this moment, the spirit and consciousness must be inwardly guarded, the breath continuous, the belly slightly drawn in, and when the navel and kidneys feel intense heat, gently release and lightly restrain.

While the navel and abdomen have not yet grown hot, tightly restrain; as warmth gradually arises, maintain constancy, allowing the will to roam freely to fill heaven and earth—this is called "restraining the Yang Barrier to refine the elixir," ensuring qi does not ascend so as to secure true water. Passing through the spleen palace, it follows the breath to be transported into the life palace and the Yellow Court. As qi and fluid undergo transformation, they change with the seasons into essence; essence transforms into pearl, pearl into mercury, mercury into cinnabar, cinnabar into gold—this is called the "Golden Elixir," and its merit is no small matter.

The essential Dao states: Gathering the medicine must rely on the Jade Hare (the heart’s qi for gathering medicine, the Jade Hare’s kidney water); their union must be aided by the Yellow Matron. When they meet in Yongzhou (the *Qian* trigram), a single yang melody is played—this is the daily practice paired with medicine-gathering.

For those in later years seeking to remedy the tenfold depletion, this method is called "refining mercury to replenish the cinnabar field." Once the replenishment is complete, one returns to the daily practice of gathering medicine in the *Li* trigram and refining it in the *Qian* trigram by restraining the Yang Barrier. In spring and winter, gather more and refine less—one part *Qian* to two parts *Li*, doubling the effort. In autumn and summer, gather less and refine more—one part *Li* to two parts *Qian*, doubling the effort. Adjust according to the season’s flourishing qi; the efficacy of gathering and refining precedes all, enabling longevity and dwelling in the world as a human immortal.

Once replenishment is sufficient and results are verified, proceed with care in practice. After one hundred days of gathering medicine, the medicine’s power is complete; after two hundred days, the sacred embryo solidifies; after three hundred days, true qi is born, and the immortal embryo is perfected. Only when the medicine’s power is complete should the fire be increased in measure—this is called "fire timing." After the sacred embryo solidifies, the fire timing increases to the measure of the Small Celestial Cycle—this is called the "Small Celestial Cycle." Once the embryo is rounded and true qi is born, the fire timing increases to the measure of the Great Celestial Cycle—this is called the "Celestial Cycle Fire Timing." Gathering medicine to unite dragon and tiger, refining medicine to advance the fire—this is called "entering the Dao."

One must dwell in seclusion, the mind fixed on inner contemplation, neither allowing inner visions to escape nor outer distractions to enter. Like a woman nurturing a fetus or a dragon tending its pearl, even in eating, sleeping, waking, or speaking, one should act like an infant or a maiden in a chamber, ever fearful of loss or harm, the heart never straying from the Dao for even a moment.

Explanation: The medicine is the true qi of the heart; the hare is the true water of the kidneys; the Yellow Matron is the true fluid of the spleen. Harmonizing qi and water, they enter the Yellow Court. Yongzhou refers to the *Qian* trigram; restraining the Yang Barrier refers to the flanks and abdomen.

Annotation: The above is the secret to peaceful longevity, the four gates of the Lesser Vehicle, pertaining to human immortality.

The Middle Vehicle’s method for attaining immortality and avoiding death comprises three gates (Volume Two):
*Elbow-Behind Flying Gold Essence, Fifth*:
[Returning essence to replenish the brain, rousing the river chariot, uniting dragon and tiger, drawing lead and adding mercury, reverting age to youth]

The *Golden Edict* states: The ascent and descent of yin and yang do not transgress the bounds of heaven and earth; the revolutions of the sun and moon lie beyond heaven and earth.

East and west govern the sun’s rising and setting to divide day and night; south and north mark its coming and going to determine cold and heat. Day and night unceasing, cold and heat alternating, days accumulate into months, months into years. The accumulation of days into a month arises from the spirit (*hun*) concealed within the lunar essence (*po*) and the lunar essence concealed within the spirit. The accumulation of months into a year arises from the *lü* tones emerging within the *lü* and the *lü* emerging within the *lü* tones.

The sun and moon revolve to align with the mechanism of heaven and earth, never departing from the reckoning of *Qian* and *Kun*. Though the generation and completion of the myriad things lie in yin and yang, creation also relies upon the sun and moon.

The *True Source* states: The form of heaven and earth resembles an egg; within the six directions, its roundness is like a sphere. The sun and moon rise and set, revolving above one heaven and below one earth. Above and below, east and west, they circulate like a flying wheel. Rising in the east and setting in the west, the sun travels the Yang path; rising in the west and setting in the east, the moon travels the Yin path. Within a single day, they divide day and night. After the winter solstice, the sun rises from the south and moves northward. After the summer solstice, the sun rises from the north and moves southward. Winter’s night is summer’s day; summer’s night is winter’s day. Within a single year, they determine cold and heat.

The sun and moon each span 840 *li* in diameter. Four *chi* make one *bu*, and 360 *bu* make one *li*. Eight *ke* and twenty *fen* make one *shi*; twelve *shi* make one day. One month consists of thirty days, totaling 360 *shi*, amounting to 3,000 *ke* and 180,000 *fen*.

Now, Yang follows *Qian*, its number being nine; Yin follows *Kun*, its number being six. The spirit is born within the lunar essence at dawn. Since nine does not pair with six, three days later the spirit begins to grow within the lunar essence. In one day and night—100 *ke* and 60 *fen*—the spirit advances 70 *li* within the lunar essence. Over six days and nights, it advances 420 *li*, at which point the spirit fills half the lunar essence, known as the "first quarter." Another six days and nights advance it 420 *li*, totaling 840 *li*, filling the lunar essence entirely. With Yang full in the Yin position, this is called the "full moon."

Beginning on the sixteenth day, the lunar essence grows within the spirit. In one day and night—100 *ke* and 60 *fen*—the lunar essence advances 70 *li* within the spirit. Over six days and nights, it advances 420 *li*, filling half the spirit, known as the "last quarter." Another six days and nights advance it 420 *li*, totaling 840 *li*, filling the spirit entirely. With Yin full in the Yang position, the moon retains residual light because six does not exhaust nine. Three days later, the lunar essence fills the palace, known as the "dark moon."

After the new moon, nine emerges within six; before the dark moon, six emerges within nine. Though the reckoning is not yet complete, the next cycle begins in due course. Days accumulate into months, months into years.

In terms of months, the six *lü* and six *lü* tones begin with six, exhausting the six positions. Six times six is thirty-six, the completion number of Yin. In terms of days, five days make one *hou*, and seventy-two *hou* comprise the number eight times nine. At the double ninth, reckoning begins with nine, exhausting the six positions. Six times nine is fifty-four, the completion number of Yang. One six and one nine together make fifteen. Fifteen is the number of one *qi*. The twenty-four *qi* correspond to the eight nodes, revealing the proper ascent and descent of yin and yang.

One six and one nine, multiplied by four, yield the four seasons. Each season totals ninety, and four times nine is 360. Transformed, this becomes the Yang number 216 and the Yin number 144, together totaling 360 to complete the celestial revolution.

As an analogy: the ascent and descent of yin and yang within heaven and earth resemble the method of harmonizing the qi and fluids of the heart and kidneys. The revolution of the sun and moon beyond heaven and earth resembles the practice of *Elbow-Behind Flying Gold Essence*. The union of sun and moon is the method of advancing fire and reducing it. The ascent of Yang and descent of Yin differ not from the spirit and lunar essence of the sun and moon. The sun’s departure and moon’s arrival differ not from the qi and fluids of the heart and kidneys.

After the winter solstice, the sun rises at the *yi* position and sets at the *geng* position, with forty *ke* of daylight. Moving from south to north, over nine days it rises in the east and sets in the west, advancing sixty *fen* in total. By the spring equinox, day and night equalize, continuing until the summer solstice, when daylight reaches sixty *ke*. After the summer solstice, the sun rises at the *jia* position and sets at the *xin* position, with sixty *ke* of daylight. Moving from north to south, over nine days it rises in the east and sets in the west, retreating sixty *fen* in total. By the autumn equinox, day and night equalize, continuing until the winter solstice, when daylight returns to forty *ke*. The division of *ke* between day and night follows this pattern of advance and retreat from south to north.

After the new moon, on the third day the spirit is born within the lunar essence. By the sixth day, they balance, and after another six days the spirit is complete, its number being nine. After the full moon, the lunar essence is born within the spirit. By the sixth day, they balance, and after another six days the lunar essence is complete, its number being six.

At the summer solstice of the year and the sixteenth day of the month, one employs the method of the *Li* trigram, corresponding to the *wu* hour of a person. At the winter solstice of the year and the new moon, one employs the method of the *Kan* trigram, corresponding to the *zi* hour of a person. The proper ascent and descent of yin and yang in heaven and earth, the principles of spirit and lunar essence in the sun and moon, are all reckoned by number, their union orderly and their revolution unerring. Though the daily use of the heart and kidneys’ qi and fluids, the liver and lungs’ spirit and lunar essence, follows a sequence, how can there be no adjustment over months and years?

The *True Formula* states: When Yang is born in the *Kan* trigram, it is precisely the *zi* hour, neither beginning nor end. When the kidney qi meets the liver qi in the *Gen* trigram, before their union, sit upright in a quiet chamber, dressed and holding the fists, knees crossed. Tuck in the abdomen, then rise slightly, thrusting the chest forward and tilting the head back. Close the double gates of the spine, and gently move the elbows backward once or twice. Stretch the waist, and from the *Weilü* point, let the qi rise like fire, ascending from the waist to gather at the spine. Take care not to open the gates; when the heat is strong and the qi robust, gradually open the gates of the spine and release the qi to pass through.

Still facing upward, press the back of the head firmly backward to close the upper gate; take care not to open it. Once the heat becomes extreme and the qi robust, gradually open the gate to let the qi ascend into the crown, thereby replenishing the *Niwan* and the Sea of Marrow. Only when the body can endure cold and heat is this the foundation of longevity. Next, employ the method of *Returning the Elixir*.

As before, thrust the chest forward, stretch the waist, and close the *Jiaji* gates. Crouch and then extend; if the fire in the waist does not rise, sit in quiet meditation and repeat the method until the fire is kindled. Begin at the *chou* hour and continue until the end of the *yin* hour, at which point one may stop. This is called *"Elbow Fluid Flying Golden Essence"* and also *"Drawing Lead,"* whereby the qi of the kidneys generates the qi of the liver.

Moreover, the human spine has twenty-four vertebrae: from the bottom upward, the first three correspond to the internal kidneys; from the top downward, the last three are called the *"Celestial Pillar."* Above the Celestial Pillar lies the *"Jade Capital."* Below the Celestial Pillar, opposite the internal kidneys and above the *Weilü* point, are eighteen vertebrae, among which is the *"Double Gate."* Nine above and nine below—after one hundred days of steadfast practice, the qi traverses all eighteen vertebrae to enter the *Niwan*.

This must be performed precisely at the hour of the *Kan* trigram’s solitary Yang, known as *"Elbow Behind Flying Golden Essence."* The *Li* trigram governs the gathering of medicine, the *Qian* trigram the stoking of fire to refine the medicine, and the *"Restraining the Yang Gate."* After the first hundred days, the *Flying Golden Essence* enters the brain; with a single surge through the three gates, it ascends directly into the upper palace of *Niwan*, beginning with the *Kan* trigram and concluding with the *Gen* trigram.

When the *Li* trigram gathers medicine, the qi of the heart and kidneys unite, and the qi of the liver naturally arises from the qi of the heart. Once the two qi become purely Yang and the eight measures of Yin dissolve, they steam the lungs, causing the lung fluid to descend. Enveloping the true qi, it grows daily to the size of a millet grain before entering the *Yellow Court*, at which point it is called *"the material of the Inner Elixir."* Only after a hundred days without error is the medicinal potency complete.

Whenever the *Li* trigram gathers medicine, observe the timing with ever-greater precision. For the *Qian* trigram’s stoking of fire to refine the medicine and restraining the Yang Gate, begin with the *Dui* trigram and conclude with the *Qian* trigram. After another hundred days, the *Elbow Behind Flying Golden Essence* proceeds from the *Kan* trigram to the *Zhen* trigram. When the *Li* trigram gathers medicine, follow the previous method, coordinating it with practice from the *Kun* to the *Qian* trigram. After two hundred days without error, the Sacred Embryo solidifies. The method of restraining the Yang Gate concludes with the *Kun* to *Qian* trigrams. After another full hundred days, the *Niwan* is replete, and one reverts from old age to youth, no longer resembling ordinary people.

Once the medicine is gathered and the Embryo Immortal perfected, true qi is born—round as a pellet, its color like a red tangerine—forever abiding in the *Cinnabar Field* as an earthbound immortal. After three hundred days, cease gathering medicine at the *Li* trigram and restraining the Yang Gate at the *Kun* trigram, then proceed with the *Jade Fluid Returning Elixir* method. Thus, beginning after the Winter Solstice is called *"practicing the work."* After three hundred days, the embryo is complete, the qi full, the Inner Elixir achieved, and true qi born.

This method alone constitutes the *"Inversion of the Five Phases"* and the *"Reversal of the Three Fields."* Before practicing the work, one must first harmonize Yin and Yang, ensuring the mutual generation of qi and fluid until verification is achieved. Next, gather and disperse Water and Fire, securing the root and medicine so that qi flows while fluid abides, verified before proceeding. Then, unite the Dragon and Tiger, refining the elixir through gathering, replenishing, and returning, forging Lead and Mercury until verification is achieved. Once the count of *"ten depletions and one replenishment"* is fulfilled and qi and fluid mutually generate, verification is achieved.

The above practices belong to the Lesser Vehicle, sufficient for prolonging life and enhancing longevity. Only after replenishment is complete and firmness verified may one proceed: select the month of the Winter Solstice within the year; the day of *jiazi* within the month; and the hours of the *Kan*, *Li*, and *Qian* trigrams within the day to begin. For the first hundred days, proceed from *Kan* to *Gen* and from *Dui* to *Qian*. After two hundred days, proceed from *Kan* to *Zhen* and from *Kun* to *Qian*.

All such practice must be conducted in a secluded chamber within a tranquil dwelling, far from women and girls, where the sounds of chickens and dogs are unheard, foul odors do not enter the nose, the five flavors do not pass the lips, the seven emotions and six desires are severed, and diet—whether in quantity, temperature, or degree—is measured. Even in waking and sleeping, one must guard against loss. If practice is not diligent, the Way will be difficult to achieve! After three hundred days, observe the results.

A direct explanation states: This is the method of the *"Three Origins,"* namely: the *Kan* trigram’s *Flying Golden Essence*, returning the Lower Field to the Upper Field; the *Li* trigram’s gathering of medicine, returning the Lower Field to the Middle Field; and the *Qian* trigram’s restraining of the Yang Gate, returning the Middle Field to the Lower Field. This is also called the *"Reversal of the Three Fields."*

The *Essentials of the Dao* states: *"The sun and moon traverse the* Fu *trigram (midnight); crouch and rise for several days to open the gates, greedily hastening toward Yangzhou for assembly (the* Li *trigram’s union); the six palaces’ fire fills the Golden Field (the* Qian *palace)."*

An explanation: *"The sun and moon traversing the* Fu *trigram"* refers to the hour of solitary Yang—at the daily level, the *zi* hour; at the yearly level, the Winter Solstice—what was meant by selecting the day within the month and the hour within the day. The *"crouch and rise"* method was described earlier; *"several days"* refers to the fixed hundred days for opening the gates, first the middle gate, then the upper gate. *"Greedily hastening toward Yangzhou for assembly"*—*Yangzhou* corresponds to the heart in the human body, to the *wu* hour in the day, and to the *Li* trigram. *"Assembly"* refers to the union of true Yin and true Yang, hence *"gathering medicine."* *Qian* represents the six palaces; *"fire"* is qi. Restraining the Yang Gate gathers qi, using lung qi as Metal to descend to the kidneys’ *Cinnabar Field*, hence *"fire fills the Golden Field"*—this is practicing the *Qian* trigram to restrain the Yang Gate and gather fire in the Lower *Cinnabar Field.*

A direct explanation: *"The sun and moon traversing the* Fu *trigram"* refers to the *jiazi* hour of the Winter Solstice. *"Crouch and rise for several days to open the gates"* means crouching the abdomen and rising the body to kindle fire, opening the gates after a hundred days.

From *Kan* to *Gen*, this is the method of flying golden essence. The *"assembly at Yangzhou"* refers to gathering medicine from the *Li* trigram, the union of Yin and Yang. When fire fills the six palaces of the *Cinnabar Field*, the *Qian* trigram restrains the Yang Gate, gathering lung qi in the Lower Field—this is the path from *Dui* to *Qian*.

On the road to Zhongnan, mountains appear:
*"Rising the body, passing the Three Gates again and again,
Greedily gathering at Yangzhou for assembly—
How could it compare to the maiden burning heaven?"*

Explanation: *"Zhongnan"* refers to the Sage’s hidden intent in the *Middle Son*—the *Middle Son* is the *Kan* trigram. *Gen* is the mountain, the *Gen* trigram. The flight of golden essence halts at the *Xun* trigram, the time of the two-hundredth day of practice. *"Rising the body, passing the Three Gates again and again, greedily gathering at Yangzhou for assembly"* has been explained before. *"How could it compare to the maiden burning heaven?"*—the *maiden* is the *Dui* trigram, and restraining the Yang Gate only ceases at the *Qian* trigram.

From Yanzhou to Xuzhou,
*"Rising to walk, wearing out cart and ox—
For love of the assembly across the Nine Provinces,
Fire enters Yongzhou in the southwest."*

Explanation: *Yanzhou* is the *Gen* trigram; *Xuzhou* is the *Xun* trigram. The flight of golden essence begins at *Gen* and halts at *Xun*. *"Rising to walk, wearing out cart and ox"*—the *cart* is Yang, the *ox* is Yin, signifying the single qi of the spinal column flying into the *Mud Pill*. The *Nine Provinces* correspond to the heart in the human body and to the *wu* hour in the day, the same as the earlier gathering of medicine. The *southwest* is the *Kun* trigram; *Yongzhou* is the *Qian* trigram. Restraining the Yang Gate ceases from *Kun* to *Qian*, the time of the three-hundredth day of practice.

Direct Explanation: This is the three-hundredth day of practice, the method of flying golden essence, beginning at *Gen* and halting at *Xun*. The assembly of the *Nine Provinces* gathers medicine as before, while restraining the Yang Gate ceases from *Kun* to *Qian*. This is the daily practice, called the *"Three Origins Method"*:
- Flying golden essence into the brain, the Lower Field returns to the Upper Field.
- Gathering medicine, the Lower Field returns to the Middle Field.
- Burning medicine to advance fire, the Middle Field returns to the Lower Field.

This is the *"Three Origins Practice"*, the method of the *Middle Vehicle*—already an Earth Immortal. The signs of verification appear as follows:
At first, one dreams frequently with startling palpitations; the four limbs and six viscera, if afflicted, heal without treatment. In a dark room with eyes closed, a circular radiance like a canopy surrounds the body. The *Golden Gate* and *Jade Lock* are sealed firmly, preventing dreams and leakage.

With a thunderous peal, the joints become interconnected. In dreams, one may embrace an infant and return, or soar freely in flight. The eight pernicious qi cannot invade; the heart’s realm is cleansed, cutting off all passions and desires. Inner vision grows luminous yet unobscured. By day, the spirit’s radiance is clear and refined; by night, the Cinnabar Field warms of itself. All these are signs of having obtained the medicine.

Once the signs are verified as correct, one must diligently regulate practice and, following the previous method, add three hundred more days—then the Embryonic Immortal will be complete. Only after the embryo is perfected may the subsequent practices be undertaken.

**Sixth: The Jade Fluid Returns as Cinnabar**
*(Jade Fluid Refines Form • Bathing the Embryonic Immortal • Minor Return Cinnabar • Major Return Cinnabar • Sevenfold Return Cinnabar • Ninefold Cyclic Cinnabar)*

The *Jade Scripture* states: True Yin and True Yang mutually engender and complete one another. That which manifests above is accumulated Yang forming spirit—within spirit lies form, and that which adorns the heavens is the sun and moon. That which manifests below is accumulated Yin forming shape—within shape lies spirit, and that which adorns the earth is gold and jade. The essence of gold and jade lies hidden within mountains and rivers; their refined and radiant qi floats above. Exchanging brilliance with the sun and moon, grasses and trees receive it to become auspicious omens, while birds and beasts obtain it to become extraordinary species.

The *True Source* says: When Yang ascends to heaven, the Supreme Ultimate generates Yin—Yin is insufficient while Yang is abundant, thus accumulated Yang gives birth to spirit. When Yin descends to earth, the Supreme Ultimate generates Yang—Yang is insufficient while Yin is abundant, thus accumulated Yin gives birth to form. Above, the sun and moon; below, gold and jade. True Yang possesses spirit; True Yin possesses form. Their qi intermingle, shooting upward and downward, filling heaven and earth with light—thus the preciousness of gold and jade arises from this.

Know then that when the qi of gold and jade congeals in the void, it becomes propitious vapors and auspicious clouds; when it enters the earth, it transforms into sweet springs and magic mushrooms. People who receive it become heroes; birds and beasts who obtain it give birth to marvels. Though the essence of gold and jade is born from accumulated Yin’s form, it embraces the qi of True Yang, further influenced by the sun and moon formed from accumulated Yang’s spirit. The downward irradiation of True Yin and True Yang causes treasures to coalesce.

This may be likened to: accumulated Yin forming shape, yet inwardly embracing True Yang to become gold and jade—just as accumulated medicine embraces True Qi to become the Embryonic Immortal. When the qi of gold and jade enters the earth and becomes sweet springs and magic mushrooms, it is like the Jade Fluid returning to the Cinnabar Field. When the qi of gold and jade congeals in the void as propitious vapors and auspicious clouds, it is like qi refining form and substance.

Whenever the qi of gold and jade surges into the heavens, it rises with ascending Yang; whenever it enters the earth, it descends with settling Yin. Since it follows the ascent and descent of Yin and Yang, it naturally possesses the four seasons. Thus, one may return fluid to the Cinnabar Field and refine form with qi, adjusting according to the four seasons—transforming day by day.

The *True Oral Instructions* state: After verifying the effects of gathering and replenishing, choose the month within the year, the day within the month, and the hour within the day. Practicing in three periods: after one hundred days, the medicine’s power is complete; after two hundred days, the Sacred Embryo solidifies; after three hundred days, True Qi is born, and the Embryonic Immortal is perfected. Diligently regulate practice, adding time according to the seasons. Only after completing the full three hundred days may one proceed with the method of returning cinnabar and refining form.

In all cases, when using the *Gen* trigram, fly the golden essence into the brain, stopping at the *Xun* trigram—this refers to flying the golden essence after three hundred days. Cease gathering medicine with the *Li* trigram and restrain the Yang Gate with the *Kun* trigram. Only the *Dui* trigram is used to begin restraining the Yang Gate, stopping at the *Qian* trigram. Having ceased the *Li* trigram, add the swallowing method to refine form.

The swallowing method: With the tongue, stir between the upper palate and the two cheeks. First swallow the foul and turbid saliva, then retract the tongue tip to fill the Jade Pool, allowing Jade Pool fluid to generate. Swallow without rinsing.

- During the three months of spring, when Liver Qi is abundant and Spleen Qi is weak, use the *Li* trigram for the swallowing method each day.
- During the three months of summer, when Heart Qi is abundant and Lung Qi is weak, use the *Xun* trigram for the swallowing method each day.
- During the three months of autumn, when Lung Qi is abundant and Liver Qi is weak, use the *Gen* trigram for the swallowing method each day.
- During the three months of winter, when Kidney Qi is abundant and Heart Qi is weak, use the *Zhen* trigram for the swallowing method each day.
*(Flying the golden essence does not interfere with swallowing.)*

During the four seasonal months, when Spleen Qi is abundant and Kidney Qi is weak—since Kidney Qi is the root source, it weakens in all four seasons—during the last eighteen days of each seasonal month, use the *Dui* trigram for the swallowing method daily, combining it with the previous swallowing method. Only in autumn, cease the practice of the *Gen* trigram and use solely the *Dui* trigram swallowing method.

For the above swallowing method, first follow the previous method to swallow. If saliva does not generate between the teeth and the Jade Pool, simply fill the upper and lower mouth with the tongue, close the Jade Pool, draw in the cheeks, and swallow emptily—this is the method. Swallow only qi, for within qi there is naturally water.

Swallowing qi: in the first year (thirty-six to forty-nine times), then the next year (eighty-one times), and the following year (one hundred eighty-one times)—these are the signs of verification, the method of the Jade Fluid returning as cinnabar. Practicing for no more than three years, irrigating the Cinnabar Field, bathing the Embryonic Immortal, True Qi grows ever more abundant.

If practicing this method of the Jade Fluid returning as cinnabar, after three hundred days of nurturing the inner cinnabar, True Qi is just born. When the *Gen* trigram flies the golden essence, striking through the Three Passes to reach the Mud Pill Palace, one should then practice the method of the Golden Fluid returning as cinnabar: from the crown’s center, let a stream of golden water descend to return to the Yellow Court, transforming gold into cinnabar—this is called *"Golden Cinnabar."*

When practicing the Golden Fluid returning as cinnabar, choose a secluded chamber where wind, sunlight, and ordinary people cannot reach. Burn incense, stack the palms, and sit cross-legged. First crouch the body, then rise. As soon as fire arises, sit upright, cutting off thoughts and forgetting emotions. Inwardly observe with precision: the *Gen* trigram flies the golden essence into the crown. Slightly raise the head and tilt the neck back, allowing the neck below to feel like fire. Then nod the head forward, lower the head and curve the neck, retract the tongue tip and press it against the upper palate.

Above flows the pure, cool water, its flavor sweet and fragrant, ascending to pierce the crown’s gate and descending to connect the hundred vessels. From the nose arises naturally the scent of true fragrance; upon the tongue, too, an extraordinary taste. Without rinsing, swallow it down to return to the Yellow Court—this is called *"Golden Fluid returning as Cinnabar."*

Through spring, summer, autumn, and winter, regardless of the hour, only after the golden essence has flown into the brain, proceed with this method in sequence: from *Gen* to *Xun* and no further. For the evening’s *"Restraining the Yang Pass"* method, proceed from *Dui* to *Qian* and no further. In practicing this method, strictly regulate each step beyond what came before—only then may success be attained. Ultimately, this practice refines the form to abide in the world, achieving longevity and deathlessness, yet it cannot transcend the cycle of existence.

The essential teaching of the Dao states:
*Recognize the root and stem of the Five Phases,*
*Then you will know the seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter.*
*Drink several cups of nectar,*
*Intoxicated, return to wander the Moon Palace.*

Explanation:
*"Recognize the root and stem of the Five Phases"* refers to inverting the Five Phases’ mutual generation and restraint, employing the trigrams at different times to perform the swallowing method. Only then will you understand how spring, summer, autumn, and winter shift the proper hours.
*"Nectar"*: Jade Fluid.
*"Moon Palace"*: The Cinnabar Field.
*"Intoxicated return"*: Swallowing in abundance.

Gazing eastward toward Fusang before dawn breaks,
Rear ascends while front swallows without cease—
Steeds gallop through the cosmos in fiery flight,
The eldest son reaches only Yangzhou.

Explanation:
*"Gazing eastward toward Fusang before dawn breaks"*: Before the sun rises, the time of the Gen trigram.
*"Rear ascends"*: Flying golden essence.
*"Front swallows"*: Jade Fluid returning as elixir.
*"Steeds gallop in fiery flight"*: Jade Fluid refining the form.
*"Wandering the cosmos"*: Filling the four limbs.
*"Eldest son"*: The Zhen trigram.
*"Reaches only Yangzhou"*: The Li trigram.
The refinement of form through Jade Fluid begins with the Zhen trigram and ends only at the Li trigram.

Direct Explanation:
Jade Fluid is the essence of the kidneys. When it ascends to the heart, the two qi merge and pass the Towering Stairs, filling the Jade Pool—this is called "Jade Fluid." If swallowed from the middle field into the lower field, it is called "returning elixir." If it ascends from the middle field into the four limbs, it is called "refining the form," though in truth it is the same substance.

Here, after three hundred days of gathering the medicine, the count is complete and the embryo perfected, while the flying golden essence diminishes by one trigram, and the Yang Barrier is restrained as before. The gathering of medicine ceases, and the swallowing method is added, adjusting with the four seasons.

This pertains to the method of refining the form. After employing the trigrams, refinement of the form is incorporated, beginning with the Zhen trigram and culminating at the Li trigram, without fixed years, months, or days—continuing only until signs manifest:
The body’s complexion becomes radiant, the spirit’s qi refined and graceful;
Gradually averse to foulness, it purges mouth and belly;
Worldly passions and attachments dissolve of themselves.

The true qi nears fullness, and one feels perpetually sated; though little is eaten, wine may be drunk without limit. The mortal bones have already transformed, altering the spirit’s perception. Walking or galloping on horseback, the body moves as if flying. The eyes gleam like polished lacquer, the flesh resembles congealed lard; dark hair regrows, wrinkled skin smooths anew, and the aged forever retain a youthful visage. Gazing upward a hundred paces, one discerns the autumn down; across the body, old scars and blemishes naturally vanish. Tears, saliva, and sweat no longer appear. The sacred elixir generates flavor, the numinous fluid exudes fragrance. Between mouth and nose, true fragrance and rare savor constantly arise. Rinsing with saliva yields a buttery essence, capable of curing others’ illnesses. The entire body transforms into white ointment.

All the above are signs of the Jade Fluid Returning Elixir’s refinement of form. Once these signs manifest, cease practice. Proceed with disciplined effort, following the method in accordance with the seasons to advance further.

**Golden Fluid Returning Elixir (Seventh Stage)**
*(Attached: Golden Fluid Refinement of Form, Igniting Fire to Incinerate the Body, Golden Flowers, Jade Dew Great Completion, Yellow and White Method)*

The *Golden Proclamation* states: Accumulated Yang forms spirit; within spirit lies form. Form arises from the sun, and the sun from the moon. Accumulated Yin forms shape; within shape lies spirit. Spirit arises from metal, and metal from earth. That which follows Yin and Yang in arising and vanishing is the light of sun and moon—its radiance born of the child, its reckoning rooted in Qian and Kun. That which follows Yin and Yang in ascending and descending is the qi of metal and jade—its vitality born of the seasons, its timing rooted in Heaven and Earth.

The *True Source* says: The light of sun and moon employs nine after dawn and six before dusk—six and nine being the numbers of Qian and Kun. The qi of metal and jade ascends in spring and summer, descends in autumn and winter—ascending and descending in accord with Heaven and Earth’s seasons. Metal is born of earth, jade of stone, stone of earth—thus manifesting in form below. Within the sun dwells the Golden Crow, within the moon the Jade Hare; the moon awaits the sun’s soul to shine—thus manifesting in spirit above.

By analogy: Sun and moon correspond to qi; kidney qi to the moon, heart qi to the sun. Metal and jade correspond to fluid; kidney fluid to metal, heart fluid to jade. The so-called *Jade Fluid* originally ascends from kidney qi to the heart, uniting with heart qi. The two qi merge, passing the *Double Towers*, the mouth sealed so that saliva fills the *Jade Pool*. Swallowing it is called *Jade Fluid Returning Elixir*; ascending it is called *Jade Fluid Refinement of Form*. This fluid originates in the kidneys and is born in the heart—akin to the saying that stone arises from earth, and jade from stone.

The so-called *Golden Fluid* arises when kidney qi unites with heart qi without ascending, steaming the lungs. The lungs, as the *Flowery Canopy*, enshroud the two qi. Drawing lung fluid from the *Lower Field* at midday, it ascends from the *Weilü* cavity, called *Flying Golden Essence Entering the Brain*, replenishing the *Mud Pill Palace*. Descending once more to the *Lower Field* is called *Golden Fluid Returning Elixir*. After returning to the *Lower Field*, it ascends again, suffusing the entire body. Rising once more is called *Golden Fluid Refinement of Form*—this, too, aligns with the saying that metal is born of earth.

For those refining form and flying the Golden Essence, practice must occur in a quiet chamber, strictly shielding from wind and sunlight. From afar, burn incense and secretly invoke the Three Pure Ones and Supreme Sages: *"This disciple wishes to abide long in the world, transmitting and practicing the Great Dao, propagating and teaching others. First, I shall personally practice the method of refining form, desiring to become unafraid of cold or heat, abstain from grain, and transcend beyond Yin and Yang."* After the incantation, proceed with swallowing.

The *True Formula* states: Behind the body, the *Weilü* cavity is called the *Lower Pass*; the spine’s sides, the *Middle Pass*; the back of the brain, the *Upper Pass*. Begin flying the Golden Essence to unblock the Three Passes. The kidneys correspond to earth, the heart to heaven—ascending to the crown corresponds to the Nine Heavens. Jade Fluid refinement of form, from heart to crown, unblocks the Nine Heavens. After three hundred days, the great medicine is complete, the immortal embryo perfected, and true qi generated.
